thread.title: What’s on TV this week? The 7 shows worth watching
thread.title_full: What’s on TV this week? The 7 shows worth watching

author: Shannon Molloy
title: What’s on TV this week? The 7 shows worth watching
text:
Watch this ... the seven television shows worth tuning in to this week. Picture: iStock
Shannon Molloy News Corp Australia THERE’S no shortage of shows to watch on television at the moment, with the networks bringing out the big guns for the final quarter of the year.
We’ve gone through the listings for all the free-to-air and subscription channels to find the very best of what’s on the small screen this week.
Raw viewing ... Diaries of a Broken Mind. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
DIARIES OF A BROKEN MIND
This wideranging doco shares the first-hand experiences of 25 young people living with mental health issues, and the often rocky road they encounter. It’s a fascinating way to kick off Mental Health Week .
Sunday, 8.30pm, ABC2
Gripping drama ... Ruth Wilson and Dominic West in The Affair. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
THE AFFAIR
The second season of this gripping US drama begins, focusing on those most affected by the fallout of the affair between Noah and Alison — their partners. Everyone is slowly unravelling, especially Cole, Alison’s husband.
Monday, 7.30pm, Showcase
Singing contest ... James Blunt, Guy Sebastian, Chris Isaak and Dannii Minogue for The X Factor. Picture: Jonathan Ng Source: News Corp Australia
THE X FACTOR
The competition to find Australia’s next big singing superstar comes to an end for one hopeful tonight, when 11 become 10 in a live decider. This far out from the final, it’s usually pretty easy to pick who might be on the chopping block ... but I can’t.
Tuesday, 7.30pm, Seven
Local series ... Alex Dimitriades in The Principal. Source: Supplied
THE PRINCIPAL
I love — love — this gritty new Aussie drama. Alex Dimitriades is Matt Bashir, the new principal at a troubled western Sydney boys high school. He’s an idealist who wants to make a difference, but he’ll face a whole host of challenges from the get-go.
Wednesday, 8.30pm, SBS
Strange concept ... Anastasia and Faye from Gogglebox. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
GOGGLEBOX
There’s just something about watching people watch TV that Australia finds captivating. I can’t explain it, but I enjoy it. Opinionated idiot box-viewing households open up their living rooms to reveal their reactions to popular and topical shows.
Thursday, 8.30pm, Ten
Chat king ... Graham Norton hosts The Graham Norton Show. Source: Supplied
THE GRAHAM NORTON SHOW
Chat show extraordinary Graham Norton hosts Hollywood megastars Robert De Niro and Anne Hathaway as well as British actor Tom Hiddleston. It doesn’t matter who his guests are, this show is always hilarious.
Friday, 8.30pm, Ten
Good cause ... Eddie Perfect hosts the Saturday Night Crack Up. Source: Supplied
SATURDAY NIGHT CRACK-UP
It’s comedy for a good cause, with ABC’s now-annual live variety show to celebrate the end of its Mental As week of special programming. It’s hosted by Eddie Perfect and guest performers like Julia Morris and Ev Kavalee promise plenty of laughs.
Saturday, 7.30pm, ABC
Originally published as The 7 TV shows you should watch
